main.name: David Carrera
main.description: I am a sophomore at Columbia University studying Computer Science
main.bio: I am a sophomore at Columbia University studying Applied Mathematics and Computer Science. I have found that the combination of these disciplines complements my interests - technology and investment - better than any other.

work.title: Quantitative Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Developing a quantitative trading strategy with a team of interns. The software is written in Python and implements data cleaning and machine learning algorithms from scratch to predict the movement of major market indices based on various consumer sentiment metrics. We manage overfitting using feature selection techniques, with each model ranked by k-fold cross validation score.

work.title: Analyst Intern
work.description: Under guidance of the head of the Treasury Department, I carried out research on public equities to determine eligibility for investment. Provided input on investment portfolio to improve the Treasuryâ€™s returns over the long term, suggesting a more value-oriented approach. Shadowed a forex trader, learned the basics of technical analysis.

work.title: Analyst Intern
work.description: Analyzed quarterly reports, noticed inefficiency arising from oil rig selection. Developed a financial model using Excel forecasting EBITDA based on optimal oil rig combinations, presented it to district manager Adam Stanford. Model was used in executive decisions concerning rig selection
